column4: Hey there, I'm trying to share files on the network so a XP computer can download it from me but Nautilus just says "Could not change permissions" what's up?
How do I force folder sharing? Nautilius just whines ..
Anyone?:(
Your user must be in sambausers group.
also, you have to have samba installed ...
As I said, install samba and add yourself to the sambausers group.
Bue samba installed when I first opened the sharing options
Ok... then add your user to the sambausers group......
how?
gksudo gedit /etc/group ... add your user to the line that starts 'sambausers' after the last : without spaces.
you mean sambashare?
yeah... sorry
it's there
Then it should work fine.
it doesn't
What is it not doing?
Right click folder -> Sharing Options -> "Share this folder" --> Create Share -> Add these permissions Automatically --> ""Could not change the permission of folder "xx" ..
I don't even have that option... hardy?
ofc
it just says it can't :P My guess is the usual "oh you're not root, sod off then" thing that's going on?
You're in the group that has permission to do that...  what is 'ofc' though?
ofcourse sorry :P
Then I'm not sure where you're getting that option... I see "allow others to write to share" as the closest option to yours....
